t: Job 4
Eliphaz: Job Has Sinned
Then*p Eliphaz the Temanite answered and said:
“If*ipn one attempts a word with you, will you become weary? But*ld who can withhold himself from speaking?
Surely*ld you have instructed many, And*ld you have strengthened weak hands.
Your*ld words have upheld him who was stumbling, And*ld you have strengthened the feeble knees;
But*ld now it comes upon you, and you are weary; It*ld touches you, and you are troubled.
Is*ild not your reverence your confidence? And*ld the integrity of your ways your hope?
“Remember*ld now, who ever*i perished being innocent? Or*ld where were the upright ever*i cut off?
Even*ld as I have seen, Those*ld who plow iniquity And*ld sow trouble reap the same.
By*ld the blast of God they perish, And*ld by the breath of His anger they are consumed.
The*ld roaring of the lion, The*ld voice of the fierce lion, And*ld the teeth of the young lions are broken.
The*ld old lion perishes for lack of prey, And*ld the cubs of the lioness are scattered.
“Now*ln a word was secretly brought to me, And*ld my ear received a whisper of it.
In*ld disquieting thoughts from the visions of the night, When*ld deep sleep falls on men,
Fear*ld came upon me, and trembling, Which*ld made all my bones shake.
Then*ld a spirit passed before my face; The*ld hair on my body stood up.
It*ld stood still, But*ld I could not discern its appearance. A*ld form was*i before my eyes; There*ild was*i silence; Then*ld I heard a voice saying:*i
‘Can*ld a mortal be more righteous than God? Can*ld a man be more pure than his Maker?
If*ld He puts no trust in His servants, If*ild He charges His angels with error,
How*ld much more those who dwell in houses of clay, Whose*ld foundation is in the dust, Who*ild are crushed before a moth?
They*ld are broken in pieces from morning till evening; They*ld perish forever, with no one regarding.
Does*ld not their own excellence go away? They*ld die, even without wisdom.’
